Package cpsc2150.extendedTicTacToe.models

Interface IGameBoard

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbsGameBoard, GameBoard, GameBoardMem
public interface IGameBoard
This is an interface that holds the functions that are necessary in order for a GameBoard to be functional. Initialization Ensures: GameBoard contains only blank characters and is MAX_ROWS x MAX_COLS or smaller Defines: num_rows : z num_cols : z num_to_win : z Constraints: minRows < num_rows < maxRows minCols < num_cols < maxCols minNTW < num_to_win < maxNTW num_to_win < num_rows OR numToWin < num_cols [whichever is greater]

  • Method Details

    • getNumRows

      int getNumRows()
      Returns the number of rows in the GameBoard
      Returns:
      The number of rows that the grid will have
      Post:
      getNumRows = nR AND nR = #nR AND nC = #nC AND nTW = #nTW

    • getNumColumns

      int getNumColumns()
      Returns the number of rows in the GameBoard
      Returns:
      The number of columns that the grid will have
      Post:
      getNumColumns = nC AND nR = #nR AND nC = #nC AND nTW = #nTW

    • getNumToWin

      int getNumToWin()
      Returns the number of tokens in a row needed to win the game
      Returns:
      The number of markers in a row needed to win
      Post:
      getNumToWin = nTW AND nR = #nR AND nC = #nC AND nTW = #nTW

    • placeMarker

      void placeMarker(BoardPosition pos, char player)
      Places the character in marker on the position specified by marker
      Parameters:
      pos - the precise row and column of a position
      player - the variable representing the character of the current player
      Pre:
      checkSpace(pos) = True
      Post:
      curGameBoard[pos.getRow()][pos.getColumn()] = player AND [rest of board does not change just the one position in the gameBoard]

    • whatsAtPos

      char whatsAtPos(BoardPosition pos)
      returns what is in the GameBoard at position pos
      Parameters:
      pos - the precise row and column of a position
      Returns:
      the character in the precise position in the curGameBoard
      Pre:
      0 <= pos.getRow() < MAX_ROWS AND 0 <= pos.getColumn() < MAX_COLUMNS
      Post:
      curGameBoard = #curGameBoard AND curGameBoard[pos.getRow()][pos.getColumn()] = marker [If the position is filled] AND curGameBoard[pos.getRow()][pos.getColumn()] == ' ' [If the position is empty]

    • checkSpace

      default boolean checkSpace(BoardPosition pos)
      Checks to see if a space has been populated by a player or not
      Parameters:
      pos - contains the precise row and column of the position
      Returns:
      True or False: True meaning the space is available and False if it has been used or out of bounds
      Pre:
      0 <= pos.getRow() < MAX_ROWS AND 0 <= pos.getColumn() < MAX_COLUMNS
      Post:
      curGameBoard[pos.getRow()][pos.getColumn()] = ' ' AND curGameBoard = #curGameBoard

    • checkForWinner

      default boolean checkForWinner(BoardPosition lastPos)
      This function will check to see if the lastPos placed resulted in a winner
      Parameters:
      lastPos - the precise row and column of a position of the previous move
      Returns:
      True or False: True if that placement resulted in a winner, False if that placement did not result in a winner
      Pre:
      0 <= pos.getRow() < MAX_ROWS AND 0 <= pos.getColumn() < MAX_COLUMNS
      Post:
      curGameBoard = #curGameBoard AND [Check if last position is equal to NUM_TO_WIN Horizontally, Vertically, and Diagonally]

    • checkForDraw

      default boolean checkForDraw()
      This function will check to see if the game has resulted in a tie
      Returns:
      True or False: True if the match resulted in a draw, False if match has not resulted in a draw
      Pre:
      [Check for winner called after every marker was placed and did not return true]
      Post:
      curGameBoard = #curGameBoard AND checkForDraw = true [no free board positions remaining and no win]

    • checkHorizontalWin

      default boolean checkHorizontalWin(BoardPosition lastPos, char player)
      Checks to see if the last marker placed resulted in 5 in a row horizontally
      Parameters:
      lastPos - the precise row and column of a position of the previous move
      player - the variable representing the character of the current player
      Returns:
      true if there is a horizontal win and false if it is not a horizontal win
      Pre:
      0 <= pos.getRow() < MAX_ROWS AND 0 <= pos.getColumn() < MAX_COLUMNS
      Post:
      curGameBoard = #curGameBoard AND checkHorizontalWin = true [if amount of same markers horizontally = NUM_TO_WIN]

    • checkVerticalWin

      default boolean checkVerticalWin(BoardPosition lastPos, char player)
      Checks to see if the last marker placed resulted in 5 in a row vertically
      Parameters:
      lastPos - the precise row and column of a position of the previous move
      player - the variable representing the character of the current player
      Returns:
      true if there is a vertical win and false if it is not a vertical win
      Pre:
      0 <= pos.getRow() < MAX_ROWS AND 0 <= pos.getColumn() < MAX_COLUMNS
      Post:
      curGameBoard = #curGameBoard AND checkVerticalWin = true [if amount of same markers Vertically = NUM_TO_WIN]

    • checkDiagonalWin

      default boolean checkDiagonalWin(BoardPosition lastPos, char player)
      Checks to see if the last marker placed resulted in 5 in a row diagonally
      Parameters:
      lastPos - the precise row and column of a position of the previous move
      player - the variable representing the character of the current player
      Returns:
      true if there is a vertical win and false if it is not a vertical win
      Pre:
      0 <= pos.getRow() < MAX_ROWS AND 0 <= pos.getColumn() < MAX_COLUMNS (lastpos.get row in bounds and same for column
      Post:
      curGameBoard = #curGameBoard AND checkDiagonalWin = true [if amount of same markers diagonally = NUM_TO_WIN]

    • isPlayerAtPos

      default boolean isPlayerAtPos(BoardPosition pos, char player)
      returns what is in the GameBoard at position pos
      Parameters:
      pos - the precise row and column of a position
      player - the variable representing the character of the current player
      Returns:
      returns true if the player is at pos; otherwise, it returns false
      Pre:
      0 <= pos.getRow() < MAX_ROWS AND 0 <= pos.getColumn() < MAX_COLUMNS
      Post:
      curGameBoard = #curGameBoard AND curGameBoard[pos.getRow()][pos.getColumn()] = player
